unnormalised: So, there's been a lot of buzz around the increased electricity bills in Mumbai lately, right? Apparently, Adani Electricity has rolled out new tariffs, and some folks are seeing hikes of around 15% on their monthly bill. My neighbour, Mrs. Desai from flat no. 201, was telling me her bill jumped from ₹3500 to almost ₹4100!
normalised: So, there has been a lot of buzz around the increased electricity bills in Mumbai lately, right? Apparently, A-D-A-N-I Electricity has rolled out new tariffs, and some folks are seeing hikes of around fifteen percent on their monthly bill. My neighbor, Missus Desai from flat number two hundred and one, was telling me her bill jumped from rupee three thousand five hundred to almost rupee four thousand one hundred!

unnormalised: The main reason seems to be the rise in fuel adjustment charges and the overall increase in power purchase costs. Plus, peak hour charges are steeper now. One analyst from Kotak Securities estimates that households consuming >300 units could see a bigger impact. Remember that last bill you got? Check it carefully. It might be higher than usual.

unnormalised: Anyway, the good news is there are ways to manage it. Some people are switching to LED bulbs, others are using ACs less frequently, and a few are even exploring solar power options. There are online calculators that can help estimate your energy consumption. You can also contact Adani Electricity on their toll-free no. 19123 for detailed billing info. Every little bit helps, bhai!
